hints.content:
We can think of $\blueD{10} \times \greenD{3}$ as $\blueD{10}$ rows of $\greenD{3}$ circles. How many circles are there?

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: An array of 30 circles arranged in 10 rows of 3 circles each. The rows are labeled 1 through 10. The columns are labeled 1 through 3. Every circle is labeled with a number. The circles in the first row are labeled 1 through 3. The circles in the second row are labeled 4 through 6. The circles in the third row are labeled 7 through 9. The circles in the fourth row are labeled 10 through 12. The circles in the fifth row are labeled 13 through 15. The circles in the sixth row are labeled 16 through 18. The circles in the seventh row are labeled 19 through 21. The circles in the eighth row are labeled 22 through 24. The circles in the ninth row are labeled 25 through 27. The circles in the tenth row are labeled 28 through 30. !
